page.title: 17British rail permanent way
page.content: The railway runs underneath the A52 north to south. This is a four line track electrified and runs from Glasgow to London passing through Crewe junction which is about two miles to the north of our survey point. Ten passenger and eight freight trains passed Casey lane bridge in an hour. There is a cutting immediatly north of the building and a shorter one to the south. The dual track railway running under the A5020 road stawford is the local line to the Potteries.This runs from west to east across the Northen sectoin of the 'D'Block Immediatly after the railway runs beneath the M6 motorway it passes the Royal Ordance Factory and for workers in Crewe and the Pottery towns.There are four cuttings and an emparkment on
